Title: Data Analyst (4day workweek & remote)
Description:
Do you want a full remote model? If so, your future starts here!




360imprimir/BIZAY is a marketing products and services marketplace present in more than 50 countries and constantly growing due to its technological reinvention!




Our aim is to help and inspire small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to have successful communications by changing the way they develop and implement their marketing strategy.




Role:

ETL processes for the operational launch of new products on the site
Creating product-related automations
Follow and analyse market trends to ensure the improved positioning of our products




Hard Skills:

Degree in Data Science, Analytics or similar
MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
SQL Knowledge




About you:

Teamwork and communication skills
Organisational, analytical, results-oriented skills




We offer:

Meal allowance
“On the job” training
Dynamic environment
Events & Team buildings
4-day workweek (9h per day - 36h)
100% remote work (Portugal based)
Workset (PC, headphones, mouse, screen)
We know your name and address each other informally.




*Please note that only successful candidates will be contacted. Portuguese and English are required.




Find out more about us and our remote model here:

https://www.360imprimir.pt/Home/Carreiras




360imprimir/BIZAY is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination.

Title: Stage - Data Analyst
HTML:
La persona sarà inserita nella Direzione Vendite, all'interno della struttura Ad-Tech & Data.

L'obiettivo del Team è supportare lo sviluppo dell’offerta crossmediale della Concessionaria attraverso l’applicazione di strategie e soluzioni innovative al mondo dell’advertising. Tra i principali ambiti di azione del Team rientrano la capacità di comprendere nuovi trend di mercato e di guidare lo sviluppo tecnologico.


Dopo un periodo di formazione, la persona supporterà il team nelle seguenti attività:

  • gestione tramite data management platform e datalake di differenti basi dati e creazione dei profili di audience alla base dell’offerta pubblicitaria data driven;
  • gestione quotidiana dei segmenti di audience che compongono l’offerta a target (analisi, aggiornamento, diagnostica);
  • implementazione, controllo e ottimizzazione di strumenti di forecasting per la gestione delle audience e delle campagne pubblicitarie a target;
  • progetti di reporting evoluto, data visualization e predisposizione di strumenti e dashborad di analisi, ottimizzazione e automazione;
  • advanced analytics per progetti data enrichment e data activation;
  • monitoraggio e ottimizzazione della performance dei profili di audience attraverso i tool in dotazione (adserver, DMP, datalake, etc);
  • traduzione di requisiti di business in analisi e progettualità data driven;
  • riferimento per le differenti divisioni aziendali (Marketing, Sales, Operations, IT, Finance, etc..) per attività di gestione dati e di analisi avanzate;
  • condivisione del know how e dell’approccio data driven all’interno dell’Azienda.


Il/la candidato/a ideale è neolaureato in Data Science, Economia o materie affini, possiede un’ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office e della lingua inglese.

Completano il profilo proattività, flessibilità, capacità di adattamento a un contesto mutevole.

Sarà considerato un plus la conoscenza di Python, SQL ed R e dei principali strumenti di BI (Qlik, PowerBI, Tableau,…)

Title: DATA ANALYST EN ALTERNANCE
Description:
Vous avez envie d’intégrer une école à taille humaine ? Vous êtes intéressé.es par l’analyse et le traitement des données ? Sup de Vinci propose une formation complète, en bachelor Big Data.

L’école Sup de Vinci, Rennes, accompagne l’une de ses entreprises partenaires dans son projet de recrutement d’un profil Big Data en alternance pour la rentrée de Septembre 2021.

Title: Junior Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future. 




About the Role

Nielsen measures the media-consumption habits of homes globally. Our data paints a rich portrait of the audience in those markets we measure. As a pioneer and industry leader in audience measurement for more than half a century, we take pride in our technology and processes, and we are constantly searching for new ways to advance our culture of innovation and growth. 

Our areas of expertise include researching hardware, software, quality controls and business rule changes that will improve the accuracy of our data reporting. 

In this role, you will learn and become an expert in Nielsen’s TV panel data, with a focus on Meter hardware and software used for data collection and crediting. You will help to design and execute analyses, develop necessary underlying data pipelines, and help to provide data-driven recommendations based on findings.

This role can be based out of our offices in Koper or Ljubljana.




Responsibilities
Learn and become an expert in Audience Measurement, with a focus on streaming meter technology used for data collection and crediting. 
Contribute to analysis plan design, develop underlying data pipelines, execute analyses and summarize results
Identify, clean, and summarize data, potentially from disparate and complex data sources, to facilitate high quality analyses. 
Create simple, meaningful visualizations to help support data analysis and stakeholder communications 
Develop and share efficient code used for analyses
Incorporate quality checks to proactively detect and correct for errors throughout analysis. 
Provide clear data-driven recommendations based on research findings
Support senior team members in collaboration with department stakeholders (Engineering, Data Science, Technology, etc.). This includes providing status updates, developing timelines, sharing data, executing tests, presenting results, etc





Key skills
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering or equivalent experience
Proven years of experience with the following: Manipulating, analyzing and interpreting complex data sources to tell a story from data through analyses; Programming in Python, PySpark and SQL for data pipeline development used to support analytics; Trending and visualizing data within Tableau; Experience working in cloud-based environments such as AWS
Able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Embraces innovation with a readiness to explore new solutions and a commitment to rapid iteration based on customer feedback
Demonstrates strategic thinking, understanding the broader impact of data insights on product and business objectives
Good level of English








Diversity

 

Here at Nielsen, we believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Nielsen is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applications from people that are excited to work for us, regardless of their background - so please get in touch!

 

Nielsen provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to any protected characteristics under local law.

Show more

Title: Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)

Title: Analista de datos (Sevilla)
Description:
Grupo De Prado, empresa líder en el sector agrícola, en continuo crecimiento y basada en la innovación, la eficiencia y la sostenibilidad. En la actualidad, nos encontramos seleccionando Analista de datos Senior para dar soporte en nuestras oficinas ubicadas en Sevilla (La Cartuja).




¿Qué ofrecemos y que te aportará unirte a nosotros?




Con nosotros formarás parte de un equipo de profesionales cualificados y tendrás la posibilidad de desarrollarte dentro de un entorno flexible y de valores.




¿Cuáles serán tus tareas?




Tu tarea principal consistirá en proporcionar información procesable así como resolver cuestiones empresariales con datos. Como Data Analyst Senior utilizarás tanto tus habilidades analíticas como de comunicación para transmitir tu pasión por los datos. Buscamos candidatos que trabajen bien en equipo, proactivos y con excelentes habilidades interpersonales.




Además colaboraras en:




Alineación con la nueva estrategia de datos.
Generación de cuadros de mando e informes.
Elaboración de modelos predictivos y programación.
Colaboración con un conjunto diverso de departamentos para ayudar a los equipos tomar las decisiones empresariales correctas y mejorar continuamente los procesos.
Análisis de datos en profundidad para obtener ideas y recomendaciones empresariales.
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI.
Entrega y mejora de la visualización, transformación de datos y modelado y presentación de informes.
Crear gráficos de datos atractivos y comprensibles para presentar los resultados del análisis.
Comunicar los resultados del análisis a directivos/as y otros miembros del equipo.




Requisitos mínimos:




Grado en: Estadística, Matemáticas, ITM o Económicas.
Power BI (imprescindible)
Bases de datos (imprescindible)
Técnicas estadísticas de análisis de datos (imprescindible)
ArcGis (deseable)
Conocimiento de negocio agrícola/ERP agrícola (deseable)
Alguien que se sienta cómodo conectándose a cualquier API (deseable)
Inglés alto (deseable)




Te ofrecemos:




Ambiente de trabajo inmejorable: un equipo donde te sentirás valorado, apoyado e integrado desde el primer día.
Contrato Indefinido y plan de formación adaptado.
Posibilidades reales de promoción.
Acceder al club de ventajas exclusivo de la empresa.
Horario de verano: para disfrutar más del buen tiempo.
Salario competitivo en función de experiencia y valía.




Si quieres dejar tu huella en DE PRADO, apúntate a esta oferta o envíanos tu CV actualizado a seleccion@deprado.eu




Buscamos personas como tú, que estén dispuestas a marcar la diferencia. ¡Esperamos conocerte y descubrir tu talento!




De Prado es una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y apuesta por el desarrollo profesional de nuestros equipos. Nos comprometemos a tratar todas las candidaturas por igual en función de sus capacidades, logros y experiencia independientemente de su raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra clasificación protegida por la ley.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.




Responsibilities:

Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.




Candidate Profile:

Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between €45,000 and €65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.




Qualifications:

Hard Skills:

Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)

Soft Skills:

Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility




Desired Skills and Experience

Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)

Salesforce (SFDC)

SQL

Tableau

Cognos

Oracle

Hyperion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer (80%)

Working for my client a global automotive business we are looking for an Analytics Engineer to work in a newly formed team called Pricing & Analytics responsible for delivering highly detailed price analytic reports to multiple C-suite members. Key responsibilities include:

Analysing large amounts of highly sensitive information points to build highly intuitive analytic reports to support best price decision making
Access to a large amount of data-sets from various sources, collating large-amounts of data and utilising your experiences in Python or R and Databricks to start to organise, assess and deliver detailed reports
Preparation of highly visual reports and engaging with multiple stakeholders across the organisation




Successful candidates should come from the following background:

At least 3 years’ experience working in a similar role – Data Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst or Data Science
Ability to utilise a coding language of your choice (Python or R are used today) and some exposure to Databricks and Azure
Business minded and passionate about cars! You are going to be immersed in automotive data so will need to be excited about what you are seeing.
Fluent German essential (please only apply if at B2 or above and can hold a technical business interview in German)




Salary: €60k - €70k

Bonus: 10% - 15% paid yearly

Contract: Part time (80%)

Location: Dusseldorf or Hamburg




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a team that is essential to business success, with the chance to work with some of the most influential leaders across the organisation.




Please apply today to discuss the role in more detail

Title: Data Analyst – Data Quality Rankings
Description:
Puesto de trabajo: Data Analyst – Data Quality Rankings




Unidad: QAR – QUALITAT, ACREDITACIONS & RANKINGS







Esade es una institución académica global conocida por la calidad de su educación, su proyección internacional y su enfoque en el desarrollo personal integral, así como por sus fuertes vínculos con el mundo empresarial. Nuestra actividad académica engloba tres grandes áreas: la formación, la investigación y el debate social. Pretendemos impulsar un cambio significativo a través del compromiso social y la innovación.




La oportunidad

Posicionamiento global de los programas de Esade en los Rankings y acreditaciones

Conocimiento del mercado y sector.

Aportar valor a la dirección de programa y decanato a través del análisis, interpretación y aportación de conclusiones vía las diferentes fuentes de información que dispone la unidad.

Propuestas de mejora de los programas y acompañamiento en su implementación.

Apoyo en los procesos de acreditaciones y Rankings.







Tus principales responsabilidades

Datos:

Gestión de los datos necesarios en todos los procesos de la unidad

Coordinación operativa datos

Petición anual de datos

Garantizar la calidad de la información y establecer los flujos y gobernanza de acceso a la información.

Análisis datos

Mejorar la visualización de los espacios de datos para que los usuarios puedan ser autónomos en el uso de la información

Analítica:

Mantener y actualizar la BBDD de simulación

Cuadros de mandos para hacer el seguimiento de la implementación de proyectos

Benchmarks y análisis de la competencia







Cualificaciones

Experiencia previa en la gestión administrativa de datos de reporting, Data Quality, Data Analyst, o similar.

Grado/Licenciatura en ADE, Económicas o similares.

Dominio experto de las herramientas de análisis de datos, Excel y deseable conocimiento de Power BI.

Nivel alto de inglés

Capacidad de organización y orientación a calidad y resultados.







¿Qué ofrecemos?

Más de 35 días laborables de vacaciones

Política de teletrabajo

Conciliación

Plan de pensiones

Plan de retribución flexible

Subvención en comedor

Aprendizaje continuo

Acceso a plataformas con contenidos digitales de primer nivel







Do Good. Do Better

’Do Good. Do Better’ abarca nuestra razón de existir, nuestro propósito .




Como institución educativa, Esade está comprometida con una serie de valores coherentes con la calidad humana y la excelencia académica y profesional. La integridad, la sensibilidad, la diversidad, el bien común, la justicia y la sostenibilidad son de gran importancia en nuestra forma de ser y de actuar.




Somos conocidos por la calidad de nuestra formación, por nuestra visión internacional y por un enfoque claro al desarrollo integral de la persona. Basándonos en estos pilares, trabajamos con una metodología única orientada al desarrollo del talento de nuestros alumnos. Este enfoque está muy influido por la innovación y la vanguardia. En consecuencia, integramos las nuevas tendencias tecnológicas y digitales en la formación en el aula.




Compromiso con la diversidad y la inclusión

En Esade estamos comprometidos con la diversidad y ofrecemos las mismas oportunidades profesionales a todas las personas. Fomentamos el aprendizaje inclusivo y, para nosotros, el talento es un factor clave para promover la diversidad.










Le informamos que Fundació ESADE como responsable del tratamiento tratará sus datos con la finalidad de gestionar su candidatura. El interesado puede ejercitar, si lo desea, los derechos de acceso, rectificación, y supresión de los datos, así como solicitar que se limite el tratamiento de sus datos personales, oponerse al mismo, solicitar la portabilidad de sus datos, a no ser objeto de decisiones individuales automatizadas, cuando proceda, así como a retirar su consentimiento en cualquier momento dirigiéndose al Delegado de Protección de Datos en la dirección Av. Pedralbes, 60-62, 08034 Barcelona, adjuntando una copia del documento que acredite su identidad (DNI/NIE).

Puede consultar información adicional y detallada sobre Protección de Datos aquí: https://www.esade.edu/es/proteccion-datos.

Unidad: QAR – QUALITAT, ACREDITACIONS & RANKINGS



Esade es una institución académica global conocida por la calidad de su educación, su proyección internacional y su enfoque en el desarrollo personal integral, así como por sus fuertes vínculos con el mundo empresarial. Nuestra actividad académica engloba tres grandes áreas: la formación, la investigación y el debate social. Pretendemos impulsar un cambio significativo a través del compromiso social y la innovación.


La oportunidad

Conocimiento del mercado y sector.

Aportar valor a la dirección de programa y decanato a través del análisis, interpretación y aportación de conclusiones vía las diferentes fuentes de información que dispone la unidad.

Propuestas de mejora de los programas y acompañamiento en su implementación.

Apoyo en los procesos de acreditaciones y Rankings.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze client portfolios consisting of leveraged loans and HY bonds

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Work closely with the securitized products structuring team on new issue securitization transactions

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-2 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile




Morgan Stanley FID Deleveraging and Lending group (“DLG”) provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.

The Securitized Products Structuring team builds financial models to help issuers and investors optimize transaction economics and quantify sources of value and risk. The team is present both in the primary and secondary markets of these products and interacts with its counterparties in New York and London continuously.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nuestro cliente, importante Compañía del Sector de Alimentación con más de 4.000 empleados, 400 de ellos en España, y con más 30 años de existencia, necesita incorporar en modalidad Remoto o Teletrabajo el siguiente perfil profesional:        




Data Analyst




Titulación Superior, FP
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en Proyectos de Análisis de datos.  
Altos Conocimientos en Power BI y DAX.
Se valorará Conocimiento en Python o en R.
Se valorará experiencia en AZURE.
Capacidad de Colaboración y Trabajo en Equipo.




La misión principal del candidatx será la de realizar proyectos de Análisis de Datos con Power BI, incluyendo la Fase de tratamiento de datos, Análisis de datos, hasta la fase de Visualización de datos, en dependencia directa del CIO de la Compañía

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Chi siamo

Mavriq, divisione B2C di Moltiply, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator.com e Rastreator.mx). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Mavriq conta oggi più di 800 persone distribuite in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.


Posizione

Il nostro team Operations è alla ricerca di un/una Junior Data Analyst.

Come Junior Data Analyst avrai il compito di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei nostri Clienti. Ti occuperai della creazione delle dashboard per il monitoraggio sull'efficacia dei modelli e dei strumenti implementati. Inoltre, sarai coinvolto nell’efficientamento dei processi di business e nella definizione dei modelli predittivi.


Più nel dettaglio:

  • Svilupperai ed implementerai le dashboard di monitoraggio dei KPI quantitativi volte a identificare l'efficacia dei modelli e processi operativi, confrontando i risultati effettivi con piani e previsioni;
  • Supporterai i direttori operativi nella definizione della pianificazione di dettaglio per garantire consistenza tra capacità produttiva ed esigenze di business attraverso la definizione di modelli predittivi e matematici per forecast di volumi e pianificazione risorse;
  • Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse business unit aziendali per sviluppare, testare e rifinire i processi;
  • Supporterai il “change management” accompagnando gli utenti nell’adozione dei nuovi processi e delle procedure;


Cosa cerchiamo

  • Laurea in ambito scientifico/economico;
  • Esperienza lavorativa di almeno 2 anni in ruoli affini, preferibilmente in società di consulenza o aziende che operino in ambito operations;
  • Forte motivazione a intraprendere un percorso di rapida crescita, che ti vedrà gestire in autonomia progetti strategici per il business aziendale;
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi;
  • Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Excel;
  • Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team;
  • Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.

Cosa troverai da noi

  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane e stimolante;
  • Colleghi altrettanto appassionati con cui confrontarti e imparare (e anche a cui insegnare qualcosa di nuovo);
  • Possibilità di contribuire attivamente ai successi dell'azienda e di veder riconosciuti i tuoi meriti indipendentemente dalla tua seniority;
  • Flessibilità, smart working e welfare;
  • Incontri periodici di feedback che ti permetteranno di accrescere la tua professionalità e migliorare le tue performance;
  • Momenti di aggregazione, condivisione e celebrazione dei successi;
  • Iniziative volte alla formazione ed allo scambio di competenze.


Se credi che questa sia l'azienda giusta per te, mandaci il tuo CV!

Sede di lavoro: Milano, via Desenzano 2 (MM Gambara)


La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).

Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🪐 Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

✨ Malt is also…


a tech company with a human approach
a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France




Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! 🪐

Explore your future career 🔭

You would be part of Malt’s data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ✨


Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt




About You 🧑‍🚀


You have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting…)
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you’ve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts… You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau…)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow




What makes you different from others? 🫵


You have good business acumen, but you also have a “hacker” mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player




How to join the mission? 🚀


Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally 💫


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you’ll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): €9/day on your Swile card
Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
RTT: From 8 to 12 days off
Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
Malt sabbatical: Every three years, Malters is entitled to a one month paid sabbatical leave
Free books: If you’re interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt’s business, just tell us the books you’d like to read, and we’ll order them for you—without any questions asked or approval processes to follow
Remote work: Hybrid remote policy
Annual team building events




Ready? Get your ticket to Malt 🪐

  • Annual team building events

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

🌍 Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! 🚀🌟

Role Overview

The role’s purpose is to supercharge Finder’s data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.


Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data


Desired Experience And Skills


Experience working with large-scale data sets
Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
Experience in data modelling
Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience


Preferred


Familiarity with dbt
Familiarity with GitHub
Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.


Perks/Benefits


5 days of additional 'Life Leave' each year to use for life's big moments
Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
Organizational culture based on our core values
Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
Multisport card
Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
Private medical care
Lunch card
Hackofriday
Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad


Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback.
Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

🌍 Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! 🚀🌟

Role Overview

The role’s purpose is to supercharge Finder’s data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.

  • Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
  • Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
  • Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
  • Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
  • Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
  • Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
  • Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
  • Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data

Desired Experience And Skills

  • Experience working with large-scale data sets
  • Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
  • Experience in data modelling
  • Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
  • Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
  • Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
  • A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
  • A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
  • Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
  • Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience

Preferred

  • Familiarity with dbt
  • Familiarity with GitHub
  • Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
  • Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
  • Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Perks/Benefits

  • 5 days of additional 'Life Leave' each year to use for life's big moments
  • Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
  • Organizational culture based on our core values
  • Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
  • Multisport card
  • Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
  • Private medical care
  • Lunch card
  • Hackofriday
  • Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad

Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback.

Title: Senior Data Analyst H/F
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst in the Omnichannel CRM and Client Department, you will play a crucial role in the creation and evolution of the data-driven Client Strategy worldwide and across all channels of the Christian Louboutin ecosystem, with greater attention placed on both Retail and E-commerce.




You will be skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.




You will dive into our data to uncover insights, formulate recommendations, and partner with stakeholders across multiple departments (Retail, E-commerce, Digital Communication and Business Divisions) to help us understand our client behavior and patterns across all touchpoints.




You will contribute to the identification, selection and evolution of data analysis tools and will manage all client data sources, acting as a guardian of data reliability.

You will help put in place a consistent cross-channel data strategy, and work across all touchpoints to optimize data collection and enrichment.




You will put in place and evolve client data dashboards for all internal stakeholders, both at Headquarters and in the Regions, and will be a point of reference for insight interpretation.

You will cooperate with technical teams to define data flows across the systems, in the present and future data architecture, to make sure the evolution of the data environment reflects the analytics needs and requirements.













Key Responsibilities




Data Analysis and Reporting:

Analyze customer data from various sources (customer database, website, BI, Salesforce) to uncover trends and insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer engagement, retention, conversion.

Collaboration and Strategy Development:

Evolve the current segmentation according to the behavioral changes and to the Maison’s business vision.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including CRM, e-commerce, and IT, to ensure a cohesive approach to customer relationship management.
Contribute to the development of the overall client-centric strategy by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.

Data Quality and Governance:

Ensure the accuracy and integrity of customer data by implementing best practices for data management and governance.
Identify and resolve data quality issues, working with IT and other stakeholders as necessary.




Client Data Management:

Manage all client data sources and act as a guardian of data reliability.
Work with external partners to help maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Put in place and evolve client data dashboards for all internal stakeholders both at headquarters and in the regions.
Promote a data-driven culture within the team and throughout the company.




Skills and Qualifications

At least 5-7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the luxury or retail industry.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred.

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools (preferably Power BI).

High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Strong organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, with the ability to present data insights to business stakeholders.
Very good command of English (written and spoken)

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us: Our client is a dynamic and innovative, private equity backed Software company. We are seeking a motivated Data Analyst to join their growing team and help leverage data to drive business decisions.







Job Description:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in collecting, processing, and analysing data to provide actionable insights. Your work will help to understand trends, measure performance, and make data-driven decisions.







Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and validate data from various sources across Billing, Systems and Revenue Operations.
Analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualise data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Assist in the design and implementation of data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.







Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role for 1 + years
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Attention to detail and accuracy in work.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Chaberton Professionals, divisione di Chaberton Partners dedicata alla ricerca e selezione di profili di Middle & Top Management, è attualmente alla ricerca di una figura di Data Analyst per una realtà attiva a livello internazionale nei servizi dedicati alle aziende.







Descrizione della posizione




La posizione è finalizzata a presidiare lo sviluppo dei sistemi di BI e reporting di supporto alle business unit e alle direzioni di staff (in particolare alla Direzione Finance). Il ruolo prevede la stretta collaborazione con i colleghi della Direzione IT e con i partner esterni (primarie società di consulenza).




La risorsa dovrà occuparsi dello sviluppo di report e strumenti di analisi tramite l’impiego delle tecnologie Microsoft e la valorizzazione di un data warehouse alimentato da diverse fonti (ERP, CRM, sistemi divisionali, etc.).

Tra le principali responsabilità rientrano:

• progettazione di modelli di dati e configurazione di cubi di dati tramite Visual Studio

• progettazione e sviluppo di dashboard interattive e user-friendly

• creazione di report complessi (impostazione di flussi di dati; utilizzare cubi tabulari live; combinare diverse origini dati: cubi, SQL server, SP Online, SSRS, API; implementare nuove funzionalità su Power BI)

• analisi e ottimizzazione delle prestazioni dei report e degli strumenti sviluppati

• gestione di un sistema strutturato di profilazione degli utenti.




Tra le attività ricorrenti rientrano:

• partecipazione attiva agli incontri con il cliente interno e con i system integrator;

• analisi funzionale per la comprensione e la definizione dei processi operativi, dei sistemi e dei dati correlati;

• predisposizione di documenti a supporto dei progetti (verbali, presentazioni ed altro materiale utile);

• formazione, affiancamento e supporto per gli utenti dei sistemi di analisi e reporting gestiti.







Requisiti




Siamo alla ricerca di candidati che abbiano svolto un percorso di formazione coerente con la posizione (laurea triennale o magistrale a indirizzo tecnico/scientifico in materie STEM o percorso analogo.

I candidati ideali :

• hanno maturato un’esperienza nell'ambito proposto di 2-3 anni, partecipando a progetti di preparazione dati, data gateway e data warehousing

• hanno esperienza con lo stack Microsoft Business Intelligence (Power BI, SSAS, SSRS e SSIS).

• conoscono il linguaggio DAX

• hanno buona conoscenza di database relazionali e programmazione SQL

• posseggono una conoscenza di massima dei processi amministrativi aziendali (ciclo attivo, ciclo passivo)

• hanno dimestichezza con gli strumenti di produttività personale (MS Office o analoghi) e di collaborazione (MS Team o analoghi)

• hanno propensione all’ascolto, all’analisi e al problem solving

• posseggono spirito di iniziativa, curiosità e capacità di lavorare in team professionalmente eterogenei

• conoscono la lingua inglese ad un livello sufficiente a interagire con partner e fornitori su tematiche tecniche e professionali.




Rappresenterà criterio preferenziale, ma non essenziale, la conoscenza delle soluzioni Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O, Reporting Services, Report Builder, Power Automate e Power APP.




Offriamo l’opportunità di prendere parte attiva al percorso di digitalizzazione e miglioramento continuo dei processi amministrativi e gestionali, in un team giovane e competente che opera con partner professionali di assoluto rilievo e moderne soluzioni tecnologiche. E’ previsto l’inserimento diretto in azienda a tempo indeterminato, con inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati alle competenze e capacità, con possibilità di crescita all'interno di una realtà solida e strutturata, che dal 1965 ha come obiettivo il perseguimento dell’eccellenza, mettendo al centro della propria strategia di sviluppo la ricerca della qualità, l'innovazione e la valorizzazione delle professionalità dei collaboratori. L’attività potrà essere organizzata sfruttando il remote working in quota consistente, ma compatibilmente con impegni e attività.




Sede: Milano, modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong Tableau skills to analyse various sets of data and create compelling visualizations that drive strategic business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data analysis and the ability to communicate complex insights, in a clear manner.




REQUIRED SKILLSET:

A minimum of 3 years of experience with Tableau, with a proven ability to create complex dashboards and reports (having a Tableau portfolio would be a plus)
Experience working with SQL for handling complex databases
Strong analytical skills and the ability to draw conclusions from numbers and data
Good communication skills and the ability to explain data concepts and Tableau functionalities to non-technical audience
Proficiency in English (mandatory)
Interest in deepening the understanding of the business and product and in using data to better respond to specific inquiries
Experience with other data manipulation languages (such as Python) is a plus
Bachelor’s degree in: Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business, or a related field is a plus




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Prepare and analyse various datasets to identify trends and insights
Develop, maintain, and manage advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards, and other BI solutions using Tableau
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights
Present findings to stakeholders through clear and compelling visualisations and reports
Document BI solutions
Actively participating in Agile sprints and stand-up meetings to discuss progress and address obstacles?
Ensuring compliance with data security and privacy guidelines when dealing with and sharing sensitive information




THIS PROJECT WILL GIVE YOU THE CHANCE TO:

Develop BI solutions that drive business growth and act as selling points for commercial teams
Gain access to extensive geographical, time series, and GPS data, to satisfy your curiosity about how things work
Be part of global team




Please be aware that we are only considering candidates who are located in Romania.




Apply now!

*Please note that by applying to this role you are informed about your personal data being processed by Yonder for recruiting purposes. Only eligible candidates will be contacted.

You can find more details about our privacy policy here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Contexte & Objectifs




Dans le cadre de son projet d'entreprise, notre client investit dans la transformation du groupe

autour de plusieurs axes, dont la Data. La direction data est organisée autour de plusieurs

départements :

- La gouvernance et qualité des données

- La datascience

- L'IA et la dataviz

- L'écosystème Data : Plate-forme Big Data et Data Analyse




Dans ce contexte, l'équipe Ecosystème Data recherche un Data Analyst pour contribuer à différents

Uses Cases et travailler en lien avec les autres Data Analystes de l'équipe pour adresser les

nouvelles demandes et mutualiser les préparations de données.




Accompagner les Métiers et les équipes Data dans la définition de leurs besoins

(organisation et contribution aux ateliers).

Identifier les données nécessaires et coordonner leur mise à disposition par la DSI (source,

format, codification, modalités/fréquence de transfert, industrialisation)

Préparer les données grâce à sa connaissance du métier et sa maîtrise des outils de

dataprep (paramétrage de l’anonymisation, modélisation, création des Datamarts/Datasets

pour exploitation de la donnée brute ou pour de la dataviz) et en concertation avec les

demandeurs (Métiers, Datascientists, Data Gouv…)

Prendre en compte les aspects d’architecture, de sécurité (gestion des accès) et conformité

(identification des données sensibles, anonymisation des données à caractère personnel...)

Fournir un appui analytique à l’exploration et à l’analyse complexe de données notamment

pour les sujets complexes, sensibles ou de grande envergure

Contribuer à la mutualisation des données
Accompagner les utilisateurs : Montée en compétences/ Formation aux outils et aux données mises à disposition




Compétences profil fonctionnelles / Techniques attendues




Connaissance du métier de l’assurance
Maîtrise des requêtes SQL, scripts Python, R, SAS.
Connaissance des outils cloud : la maîtrise de l’écosystème AWS serait un plus
La maîtrise de Dataïku
Grande rigueur, capacité d’écoute, sens du contact, disponibilité, réactivité
Capacité d’analyse et d’approfondissement des sujets techniques et fonctionnels
Capacité à faire adhérer, à convaincre un ou plusieurs interlocuteurs du bien-fondé d’une

position

Excellentes capacités de travail en équipe
Fortes compétences de communication écrites et orales
Capacité à mettre en œuvre les actions de conduite du changement







Un minimum de 4 ans d'expérience est requis, ainsi qu'une bonne connaissance du métier de l'assurance.

Show more
HTML:
Contexte & Objectifs


Dans le cadre de son projet d'entreprise, notre client investit dans la transformation du groupe

autour de plusieurs axes, dont la Data. La direction data est organisée autour de plusieurs

départements :

- La gouvernance et qualité des données

- La datascience

- L'IA et la dataviz

- L'écosystème Data : Plate-forme Big Data et Data Analyse


Dans ce contexte, l'équipe Ecosystème Data recherche un Data Analyst pour contribuer à différents

Uses Cases et travailler en lien avec les autres Data Analystes de l'équipe pour adresser les

nouvelles demandes et mutualiser les préparations de données.


  • Accompagner les Métiers et les équipes Data dans la définition de leurs besoins

(organisation et contribution aux ateliers).

  • Identifier les données nécessaires et coordonner leur mise à disposition par la DSI (source,

format, codification, modalités/fréquence de transfert, industrialisation)

  • Préparer les données grâce à sa connaissance du métier et sa maîtrise des outils de

dataprep (paramétrage de l’anonymisation, modélisation, création des Datamarts/Datasets

pour exploitation de la donnée brute ou pour de la dataviz) et en concertation avec les

demandeurs (Métiers, Datascientists, Data Gouv…)

  • Prendre en compte les aspects d’architecture, de sécurité (gestion des accès) et conformité

(identification des données sensibles, anonymisation des données à caractère personnel...)

  • Fournir un appui analytique à l’exploration et à l’analyse complexe de données notamment

pour les sujets complexes, sensibles ou de grande envergure

  • Contribuer à la mutualisation des données
  • Accompagner les utilisateurs : Montée en compétences/ Formation aux outils et aux données mises à disposition


Compétences profil fonctionnelles / Techniques attendues


  • Connaissance du métier de l’assurance
  • Maîtrise des requêtes SQL, scripts Python, R, SAS.
  • Connaissance des outils cloud : la maîtrise de l’écosystème AWS serait un plus
  • La maîtrise de Dataïku
  • Grande rigueur, capacité d’écoute, sens du contact, disponibilité, réactivité
  • Capacité d’analyse et d’approfondissement des sujets techniques et fonctionnels
  • Capacité à faire adhérer, à convaincre un ou plusieurs interlocuteurs du bien-fondé d’une

position

  • Excellentes capacités de travail en équipe
  • Fortes compétences de communication écrites et orales
  • Capacité à mettre en œuvre les actions de conduite du changement



Un minimum de 4 ans d'expérience est requis, ainsi qu'une bonne connaissance du métier de l'assurance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In the journey of life, your career should make a difference.

At Inizio Evoke, we come together—to do the best work, in the best possible place. We’re all in. Because it’s everyone’s role to make health more human™.

Your role as a Data Analyst

The Data Analyst at Inizio Evoke Transformation will play an integral part of supporting and often driving the discovery of insights that can generate actionable change.  As the data analyst you will collect, store, manipulate, query, and utilize essential data for the purpose of advanced analyses. The ideal candidate has strong foundational data analysis skills, exposure to a wide array of different types of analysis, and the ability to translate data into insights in a story-driven narrative. The data analysts is a curious, supportive, and collaborative team player.

 

You Will:


Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns from data sets by using an array of technical/analytical tools such as Python.
Develop a deep understanding of patients, other customers, and market dynamics, and deliver insights that help the organization drive patient impact. 
Apply statistical techniques to uncover innovative recommendations for business operations to integrate recommendations into strategic decision making (such as new ways to evaluate a more efficient system for acquiring sales leads, or predicting revenue outcomes or ticket sales)
Uncover business insights and create data visualizations (including charts, graphs, and tables) to drive and facilitate strategic conversations within all business operations teams.
While driven by your team lead, you will help define clear, impactful business priorities, and develop action plans that will result in an immediate positive impact
Test analytical experiments in a methodical manner, and regularly evaluate alternate models via theoretical approaches representing the likelihood of a range of outcomes.
Assess the effectiveness of promotional efforts, projects, and practices and identify opportunities to optimize value of investments.
Collaborate within cross-functional teams to develop solutions.
Take an enterprise mindset, linking individual responsibilities with broader organization; focus on outcomes that provide most business and patient value.
Act as a thought partner and advisor to all relevant teams and stakeholders


 

You Have:


1-2 years of performance analysis experience (i.e. Campaign Analysis, basic regressions, market mix modelling, segmentation & forecasting) applied within marketing is highly preferred but not necessary, and analysis experiences within pharma/healthcare agency environment is strong plus, but also not essential.
Experience working with Python is required
Demonstrated aptitude in mathematics, basic statistics, analysis, and research
Experience pulling, validating, and cleansing data for analysis from various platforms or exposure to a multitude of different types of datasets (time based, sales based, geographically focused, performance based etc.)
Demonstrated ability to analyze large datasets, often integrating multiple datasets together
Introductory experience with statistical modelling, analysis, and presentation of results to a non-technical audience
Working knowledge of secondary data sources including syndicated sales, promotional and marketing data, longitudinal patient level data, preferred but not essential
Foundational understanding of the scientific methodology and how it applies to data analysis from establishing a hypothesis to prove or disapprove, to data gathering, cleaning, clustering, analysis, visualization and communication around data output


 

Don't meet every job requirement? That's okay! Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - EQuIS
Description:
About Us

Groundbreaker. Game changer. Pioneer.

TRC has long set the bar for clients who require more than just engineering, combining science with the latest technology to devise innovative solutions that stand the test of time. From pipelines to power plants, roadways to reservoirs, schoolyards to security solutions, clients look to TRC for breakthrough thinking backed by the innovative follow-through of an industry leader.

TRC's professionals work with a broad range of commercial, industrial and government clients and the communities they serve. We deliver breakthrough solutions that address local needs -- so our clients can better succeed in an ever-changing world.

Working at TRC means tackling interesting, meaningful projects. We pride ourselves on our collaborative spirit, entrepreneurial zeal and agile corporate structure. We recognize that the expertise of our staff is our strongest asset, so we generously reward employees for successful performance and invest in their careers through training and the development of new skills and certifications.

Overview

Our Environmental Sector delivers comprehensive environmental solutions to meet the full project lifecycle needs of clients in renewable energy, oil & gas, transportation, and manufacturing industries. With one of the largest multimedia air and land permitting and compliance teams in the country, we support client success in manufacturing and industry, liquids delivery and processing, natural gas storage and delivery, power generation and delivery, and transportation projects.

Position Summary

TRC is seeking a team-oriented Data Analyst to join our growing Environmental Data Management Practice. The position focuses on candidates with a strong background in environmental data, data management and data analysis skills. Candidates should be proficient in the use of the EarthSoft EQuIS platform and should be able to work independently or in a project team with demonstrated excellence in written and oral communications, presentations, analytical and professional judgment, and team building skills.

Responsibilities


Collect and configure large datasets to meet project specifications in support of environmental projects using the EarthSoft EQuIS data workflow.
Configure mobile data collection forms to support field data collection events.
Configure enterprise dashboards to meet the needs of project teams and stakeholders.
Develop and utilize data validation tools in Excel, Access and/or SQL to identify data quality issues.
Provide technical support to field sampling teams and act as a liaison between the project staff, analytical laboratory, data validator and GIS analysts.
Provide reporting support by generating and formatting tables, charts, or graphs.
Follow standard operating procedures and work plans, performing work in a high-quality manner.
Develop procedures and workflows for streamlining processes and enhancing efficiency.
Document work processes, compose training documents and conduct training sessions.
Implement, configure and test commercial-of-the-shelf data management related software to meet project specifications.
Participate in the TRC CORE Data Management and Assessment Team.
Must be able to work independently or on a project team.
Position requires exceptional organizational and time-management skills and attention to detail.


Qualifications


A Bachelor’s degree in Science, Engineering or Information Technology required;
2-5 experience in the environmental field with emphasis on environmental data management;
Proficiency with database software: EarthSoft EQuIS
Experience with database software: MS SQL Server and/or MS Access;
Experience configuring EarthSoft modules including Sample Planning Module (SPM), Collect, Data Quality Module (DQM) and/or EnviroInsite a plus;
Experience supporting enterprise based systems a plus;
Experience implementing mobile applications for field data collection a plus;
Experience using MS Excel to manipulate and organize data sets for import into a database and for final reporting;
Experience with Tableau, PowerBI or other analytics software a plus;
Experience performing data validation a plus;
Strong attention to detail with excellent analytical, judgment and problem solving capabilities;
High initiative, superior interpersonal skills, and ability to work with minimal supervision to manage multiple tasks simultaneously;
Possess a valid driver’s license in good standing with reliable transportation; and,
Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.


Benefits*: TRC offers a competitive benefit package consisting of:


Medical, dental, vision, and disability insurance.
401k package that includes both traditional and Roth IRA options and Company match.
Paid time off contingent upon full time or part time status and level of seniority (ranging from 15 to 25 days per year).
All full-time employees enjoy a minimum of 8 Paid Holidays per year.
TRC ensures that all employees, including those that work part-time, receive paid sick, family, and disability leave in accordance with the laws of their state of residence.
These benefits are applicable to US employees depending on their employment status (full time, part time, or temporary). TRC offers jurisdiction specific benefit packages for International and Puerto Rico employees.


Compensation: Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, geographical location, and other compensable factors.

Other Compensation: Employee may be eligible for participation in the Company’s annual Discretionary Bonus Program which is contingent on Company, Business Segment, and Individual performance against Key Performance Indicators which vary by year and employee.

Disclaimers

TRC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

The complete job description and application are available on TRC’s career site.

TRC accepts applications for this position on an ongoing, rolling basis and reserves the right to cancel this posting at any time.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Please be aware of certain scams in the market of fake recruiters offering remote jobs via telegram, whatsapp and other unconventional means of communication. All communication for roles at Insurify will come from the email domain @Insurify.com. If you receive communcation from any other source please do not share any personal information, block and report them. **


Why us?

Insurify is one of the America's fastest-growing MIT FinTech startups and has been recognized as one of Inc. 5,000's fastest-growing private companies in America of 2023, 2022 and 2021, Forbes Fintech 50 List for 2023, 22, 21, Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startups of 2022 global and Top 100 InsurTech company. We're changing the way millions of people compare, buy and manage insurance with artificial intelligence, technology, and superior product design. Our company vision is to be recognized as the preeminent and most trusted digital agent for insurance comparison, purchase, and management. Our team is critical to achieving our vision and fostering the right culture is essential to our team's success.

Join us if you like


$1.3 Trillion market opportunity
MIT alumni founders
Female-led startup
$130M total funding
Strong leadership team with experience from many successful start-up's around the world


How you will make an impact


Building scalable, robust data pipelines to power the company forward.
Bring knowledge around data modeling techniques that will maximize performance and minimize tech debt.
Improve the design and implementation of our customer acquisition bidding algorithm code.
Lead within the team and across the company regarding data best practices.
Bring your ideas, ultimately our team is about coming up with and executing data solutions to drive business growth, this isn't a role where you will just get assigned tasks with no input. We are looking for your input and vision.
Ultimately, this role is about using data to make our company better across all areas of the business, so we want someone who is excited to tackle a wide range of structured and unstructured problems using data!


What you need to succeed


B.A. / B.S. degree in technical/quantitative disciplines or equivalent experience.
Strong quantitative and programming skills with a product-driven sensibility.
Knowledge of statistics.
Expertise in and real-world experience with SQL.
Experience in data analysis in consumer / retail / e-commerce / SaaS.
Knowledge of Python (preferred) or R.
Quick learning ability and a drive suitable for the startup hustle.
A team player with a solid work ethic who is ready to pivot between projects, learn from mistakes, always move forward, and help build the next big thing in insurance!


Benefits


Competitive compensation
Generous stock options
Health, Dental Coverages
401K plan with match
Unlimited PTO
Generous company holiday calendar
Learning & Development Stipends
Paid Family Leave
Social impact volunteer time and donation matches
Catered lunches in the office


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.
